column4: hey guys, hoping you can help me with something. I have an (apparently infamous) issue wherein ksoftirqd consumes 100% of my cpu
output of dmesg | tail shows lots of messages like sr 1:0:0:0: timing out command, waited 120s
wat do?
Can't kill the process, it just respawns immediately
Anyone have any idea what I'm talking about? For reference, I'm running 2.6.35-22
This is really very frustrating. It's eating all my resources and there's no way to stop it
just uninstall?
just installed lol
what program is it again?
ksoftirqd, it's apparently a low level device thing
try upgrading kernel "sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get dist-upgrade"
running updates right now actually...and praying
if you did any updating be sure to reboot
absolutely. it's taking forever because it's using an entire core of my CPU
its a little hackish but "while [ 1==1 ]; do killall ksoftirqd; done;"
I'm a little worried about hardware problems with this as well, my CPU has to be lava hot right now, and the fan is kicking
are you overclocked or is your comp pressed up a against a wall or buried in the ground? if not you _should_ be okay....
I don't think even that will keep it down. It spawns new processes as soon as they're killed. Killing all of them will probably use about as many resources
prolly right.... but a while loop of killing is always fun right? :P
yeah I suppose lol. I'm just frustrated that I couldn't find any definitive answer for what causes this. Dates back to 2004 but no one has a real paper trail on it
I mean most people just said stuff along the lines of "it has something to do with the wireless drivers; just reinstall"
that might be a good idea if upgrading doesn't work
don't see what it'll solve though, because inevitably the same wireless drivers and ksoftirqd daemon will get installed next time
true but installs aren't infallible. its sorta a last ditch effort.
